titles.title: Heat is Power Act
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide tax incentives for producing electricity from wasted heat.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 8/1/2013--Introduced. Heat is Power Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow through 2017: (1) an energy tax credit for investment in wasted heat to electricity property, and (2) a tax credit for the production of electricity from renewable resources for wasted heat. Defines "wasted heat to electricity property" as property comprising a system which generates electricity through the recovery of a qualified wasted heat resource (e.g., exhaust heat or flared gas from any industrial process or waste gas or industrial tail gas, but not a heat resource from a process whose primary purpose is the generation of electricity using a fossil fuel).
